Introduce BlockMetadataStore so Store can use either BlockTree or ProtoArrayForkChoiceStrategy to store block metadata.
When ProtoArrayForkChoiceStrategy is used, two copies are held and the one used by Store isn't pruned.

Use the ProtoArrayForkChoiceStrategy instance from Store for everything.
Use BlockTree only for initial migration, then switch the store to ProtoArray backing.

timeline.bodyText:
To make sure I understand, the deadlock would happen in the following way?:

We enter this method, run findHead and acquire the protoarray locks
Another transaction finishes, acquires store locks, and tries to acquire protoarray locks in BlockMetadataStore.applyUpdates, but can't
findHead now tries to acquire the store locks but can't
timeline.author: mbaxter

replies.bodyText: And ProtoArrayForkChoiceStrategy.onAttestation doesn't create a similar problem because it's only acquiring the votesLock?
replies.author: mbaxter

replies.bodyText: Correct on both counts. The deadlock is between two transactions, one that's running through findHead and one that's importing blocks.
replies.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: Doesn't this only save the first epoch boundary seen as processing hashes on the chain instead of saving the latest one?
timeline.author: cemozerr

replies.bodyText: .compareAndExchange seems to only set the value to the second argument, if the reference is equal to the first argument.
replies.author: cemozerr

replies.bodyText: We're walking from the head backwards through the chain and want to capture the one closest to head, which will be the first one seen.
replies.author: ajsutton
